sections.name: Repo + Automation Hardening
tasks: Confirm create_issues.py supports JSON_PATH override via environment variable (so tech/social/etc. can be generated without editing the script each time)

Add a safe re-run guard to create_issues.py that prevents duplicate issue creation without using GitHub Search API (e.g., maintain a local .state file of created IDs, or check existing project items via GraphQL pagination)
Add README section: 'How to generate issues from JSON' (DRY_RUN, JSON_PATH, PROJECT_STATUS) so volunteers can run it safely
Add one 'reference docs' folder (e.g., docs/) and move non-task documents there (orientation, dependency maps, overviews) so they are not accidentally treated as task lists

sections.name: AI Brain Cleanup + Canonical Source-of-Truth Pipeline
tasks: Inventory what currently counts as the 'Narrative Repository / AI Brain' and where it lives (Notion vs files vs both)
Create a cleanup checklist for the AI brain: duplicates, outdated drafts, conflicting definitions, missing canon links
Define a minimal 'canonical context bundle' for AI: SIR + governance summaries + GDP narrative + commons clarification
Implement a repeatable sync/export step that produces a clean corpus bundle for bots (manual or scripted; file-based or Notion-based)
Set a rule: volatile items (phases/next-steps) live outside SIR and are retrieved dynamically

sections.name: Bot Merge Workstream (GDP + NEOS / Governance)
tasks: Update SIR first with NEOS + commons governance clarifications (confirm the merge prerequisites are met)
Create the unified canonical context set (SIR + governance summaries + GDP narrative + commons clarification)
Merge at the knowledge layer (point both bots to the same SIR + canonical narratives) rather than merging UIs/personalities
Establish a single 'Guide' identity naming convention (NEOS Guide / Commons Transition Guide / Solutionary Guide)
Run the validation check questions against the merged bot output (who governs commons, ownership change, adoption mandatory, who decides locally)

sections.name: Public Entry Flow Tech (Video → Bot → Form → Next Step)
tasks: Create a minimal public entry stack plan: where the video lives, where the bot links live, where the form lives, and where the 'next step' routes
Stand up a simple landing page (or existing page) that links: video + bot(s) + contact form + orientation hub
Implement contact form capture (email + intent + optional skills) and define where submissions route (email + GitHub intake + Notion summary)
Define a 'small-circle testing' release mode (share by link, not public broadcast) and implement toggles/notes for readiness

sections.name: CPS + Charting the Course Technical Coordination
tasks: Inventory the current CPS toolset (Notion / Heartbeat / SIMBI/Symbi) and document where each part lives and what it does
Inventory 'Charting the Course' assets and clarify what is active now vs planned later (as a system list, not SIR)
Define the intended merge path: CPS + Charting the Course into a unified profile/matching application (high-level architecture + data needs)
Identify immediate integration points (links, shared profiles, shared onboarding pathways) without building the full app yet

sections.name: BEAM Bots Readiness (Finish-to-Ready)
tasks: Inventory current BEAM bot assets (prompts, scoring logic, comparison flows)
Create a 'finish-to-ready' checklist for BEAM bots (what is missing, what must be tested, what is considered ready)
Package BEAM bot usage as a repeatable workflow (inputs, outputs, storage location, and how results are summarized back to Notion)

sections.name: Security + Multi-Sig + Ops Basics
tasks: Define where secrets/tokens live (who holds them, rotation policy, and what is allowed to be stored where)
Document the multi-sig process requirements for keys/funds (what is needed now vs later)
Create a lightweight incident/rollback procedure for: mistaken public posts, bad data imports, accidental issue floods, token exposure

sections.name: Volunteer Tech Onboarding (Lightweight)
tasks: Create a 1-page 'How to contribute in GitHub' orientation (issues, project board, labels, status) for non-technical volunteers
Create a 'proposal template' for volunteers to claim tasks (what they plan to do, dependencies, what they need, expected output)
Define a handoff standard for work completion (what gets summarized back to Notion, what goes into docs, what stays in GitHub)
